message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.SE. 

The paper presents a novel approach for monitoring real-time safety and performance requirements in smart cities using a spatial aggregation signal temporal logic (SaSTL). This involves developing an efficient runtime monitoring algorithm that can check SaSTL requirements over multiple data streams generated from thousands of sensors that are spatially distributed over a smart city. The paper also evaluates the real-time SaSTL monitor by applying it to two city application scenarios with large-scale real sensing data. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.AI (for the use of AI techniques in monitoring), cs.CR (for the focus on safety and security), cs.SY (for the system-level approach to monitoring), cs.DC (for the use of distributed computing), and cs.SE (for the software engineering aspects of developing the monitoring algorithm).
